title: Oracle and Worker Multi-Model Approach

problem.en: Using expensive, powerful models for all tasks is cost-prohibitive and inefficient.
problem.ko: 모든 작업에 비싸고 강력한 모델을 사용하는 것은 비용이 많이 들고 비효율적입니다.

solution.en: Use a powerful 'oracle' model for high-level strategy and planning, with cheaper 'worker' models for routine execution.
solution.ko: 고수준 전략과 계획에는 강력한 '오라클' 모델을, 일상적 실행에는 저렴한 '워커' 모델을 사용합니다.

mermaid_diagram:
flowchart TD
    A[Oracle: High-Level Strategy] --> B[Worker 1: Execute]
    A --> C[Worker 2: Execute]
    A --> D[Worker N: Execute]
    B & C & D --> E[Aggregate Results]
code_example:
# Oracle creates the strategy (expensive but smart)
strategy = opus.plan(complex_task)

# Workers execute (cheap and fast)
results = []
for subtask in strategy.subtasks:
    result = haiku.execute(subtask)
    results.append(result)

# Oracle reviews if needed
if needs_review:
    opus.review(results)
